Body: In lollipop (5.0.2), in the default lockscreen, I can pull down the statusbar to get the "quick actions" (I don't know exactly how is called), but I mean the quick settings, like brightness, WiFi, Bluetooth, Mobile Data, etc...Despite being usefull, I DON'T want to be able to use such settings while the device is locked, because anyone could mess with them (e.g. turn off WiFi and turn on mobile data).Is there a way to block such settings while in the lockscreen?I think there are a few lockscreen apps with such options, (not sure if they work on Lollipop), but I'd like to keep using the default lockscreen.Some notes:Moto G2 (2014)I have a pattern to unlock the screen.I am rootedI have Xposed, so maybe some module could help.I have SmartApp Lock, and I have the global settings blocked, so when I tap the Gear Icon in the status bar, I am prompted for my password.The problem is that the "direct" settings from the quick actions don't require any confirmation.Thanks in advance.
Title: Lollipop: How to block statusbar while in lockscreen
